channel.content:encoded:
This is Life is a fun, interactive and conversational podcast where we discuss real issues with a positive and wholesome perspective. Engage with Cornelius and Heather Lindsay during their special segment, "Ask the Lindseys," where you can ask real questions and receive real answers. We’re talking about everyday issues that affect everyday people with personal insight and our own mix of straight-talk and humor.


New episodes every Friday morning. Hope you join us! Subscribe today!

image.title: This Is Life with Heather & Cornelius

item.content:encoded:
In this episode, three good friends dive deep into the concept of authenticity--what it means, why it's important, and the times they've struggled to stay true to themselves. Cornelius, along with Ethan and David, have an honest conversation about masks, vulnerabilities, insecurities, and the pressures to fit in. With stories, laughs, and raw reflections, this episode is a reminder that being yourself is a journey worth sharing.

item.content:encoded:
In this episode, True to You: The Hidden Price of Authenticity, Cornelius dives into what it truly means to live authentically—and why it’s often harder than it sounds. He explores the unseen costs of staying true to yourself, from strained relationships and career risks to the vulnerability and sacrifices that come with it. Join him as he unpacks the challenges of authenticity, discusses why it’s worth the effort, and shares insights on balancing self-expression with the realities of a complex world. If you’ve ever wondered why authenticity feels so rewarding yet so difficult, this episode is for you.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.content:encoded:
What does tit for tat do to a relationship? Heather and Cornelius are giving the his and hers perspective to what confiding in your partner and others looks like. Is there a double standard when it comes to men and women sharing info with their friends and family? Finally, Heather is turning over a new leaf… listen in to find out what the final straw was.

Cuddly as a cactus and charming as an eel, he’s your new favorite snarky talk show host. Join
The Grinch (and his faithful dog Max) each week as he rants against Christmas cheer and
roasts celebrity guests like chestnuts on an open fire. Starring Saturday Night Live’s James
Austin Johnson as the notorious curmudgeon and broadcasting straight from Who-Ville, will
The Grinch send these famous folks back down Mt. Crumpit, or will they soften his stance
against Christmas and grow his heart three sizes? Grab your hot cocoa and cozy slippers and
listen along to find out!



Listen to ‘Tis The Grinch Holiday Talk Show: http://wondery.fm/TIL_tisthegrinch

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.content:encoded:
In this episode, Cornelius dives deeper into his journey of depression. He shares more about his fight with staying alive, feeling worn out and having nowhere to turn. He talks about taking medication and using edibles to cope. This is a VERY emotional episode where he shares a lot of his feelings.

item.content:encoded:
Cornelius was told that knowing about his father was the missing piece. Two weeks later, Heather spoke to her father for the first time, and he told her she was the missing piece. They talk about their experiences and discuss what it felt like to live in deprivation. They also encourage others who’ve been in their situation.

item.content:encoded:
Holidays can be difficult. Sitting around the table with family you dislike is highly likely. There’s at one uncle that loves to talk about politics, the bougie aunt who looks down on everyone and everything, the cousin that cannot get his/her life together, the cousin who’s still searching for identity and the family secrets that lurk in the background. Listen as Cornelius and Heather talk about all this and more in this special holiday episode.

We would love your feedback... If you enjoyed this episode, tell us why! Leave us a review and make sure you subscribe on your favorite podcast platform.

item.content:encoded:
Keke Palmer has questions for days, about everything under the sun. From the existential to the inconsequential. From pop culture to pop science. From the meaning of life to the meaning of W.A.P. From life in outer space to “Where the eff is Tom from MySpace?“ And everything in between. Because Baby, this is Keke Palmer, and she is here for All. Of. It.

Each week, the multi-talented Keke is taking you on a journey down the rabbit hole on a topic that she cannot stop obsessing over. She’ll also get deep with special guests, trying to answer the questions that keep us up at night. We are getting INTO IT.

www.amazon.com/BTIKP_us_pfd_AA_110122

item.content:encoded:
When Emily Gellis hears rumors of people suffering horrible side effects from a trendy diet she springs into action. Armed with over a hundred thousand Instagram followers, Emily launches a social media crusade to expose F-Factor and its founder, Tanya Zuckerbrot. It’s the start of a feud that will attract trolls, lawyers, and, eventually, national media all because of fiber. From Wondery, this is a story about wealth, wellness, and influence hosted by Casey Wilson.

Listen to Fed Up: wondery.fm/LWTL_FedUp

item.content:encoded:
In today’s inaugural Season two episode, Lauren is inviting on psychotherapist and New York Times bestselling author of Maybe You Should Talk to Someone, Lori Gottlieb! The two dive in right away as Lauren asks Lori if she always envisioned being a counselor and how to create incredible connections with others through storytelling and music. The pair also chat about: what Lori believes drives the narrative of isolation, Lauren’s personal story with counseling and mental health, how to identify what ‘wise compassion’ is, the difference between productive anxiety vs unproductive anxiety, and exactly where to start to breed more compassion. If you’re ready to understand a little more about yourself, and those around you, to ultimately cultivate deeper relationships - this episode is for you. In addition to her clinical practice, Lori writes The Atlantic’s weekly “Dear Therapist” advice column and is co-host of the popular “Dear Therapists” podcast produced by Katie Couric.



Listen here: wondery.fm/Lindseys_DaigleBites

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.content:encoded:
A big Halloween party at an apartment complex in Redmond, Washington. Themed rooms and costumed partygoers. But by the end of the party, one of the hosts is dead. The police look to the partiers as the prime suspects: was it the guy in the devil mask, the bank robber, the construction worker? As investigators comb through forensic evidence, witness testimony, DNA, and even consult with a psychic, they zero in on one suspect in particular. But for what reason? Host and reporter Matthew Shaer (Over My Dead Body) returns to the scene of the crime, speaks with everyone about a night that still haunts them years later. It’s a series about race and policing, mislaid justice, cutting-edge science, and the kinds of weighty choices that cops and prosecutors make every day -- choices that, once made, are difficult to reverse.



Listen to SUSPECT: http://wondery.fm/Suspect_LifeLindseys

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

REDFLAGS. We all have them. And when someone crosses those things we believe we absolutely can not put up with, we immediately want to throw them away. The truth of the matter is, we grow, we learn, and we change. Listen in to this week’s episode of Life With the Lindsey’s as Cornelius and Heather stress the importance of embracing what’s different or even difficult. What appears to be unbearable or unattractive now could very well be a blessing!

item.content:encoded:
Whether we want to accept it or not, the developing outcomes of Coronavirus are affecting each of us. Many of us are being forced to spend more time at home, work from home, step in as teacher for our children, assess our businesses and different ways we can make up for lost income, and more - all of which have called us to create a new normal in our lives. Listen as Cornelius and Heather talk about the importance of using this as an opportunity to examine our hearts, to draw nearer to the Father, to get more involved with family and loved ones, and more!

Whatever you focus on will become your reality. If you focus on the reports of the news then you’ll be filled with fear. Listen as Cornelius and Heather talk about the importance of being covered and never being afraid.

item.content:encoded:
Life is full of ups and downs, successes and failures and encouragement and discouragement. The goal is to discover a happy middle point of contentment so bad days don't break you and good days don't make you. Heather and Cornelius answer the age-old question: "How do I trust when I don't understand?" With life hitting us in every direction, we oftentimes don't know what to do. Join them as they tell you how to trust when you don't understand.

item.content:encoded:
In marriage, there can exist three kinds of rings--an engagement ring, a wedding ring and suffering. Unfortunately, more and more couples are experiencing a great deal of suffering. In this episode, we share our personal marriage story. We share some things that we've never shared publicly before. Ultimately, everyone from singles to married couples will get something out of this because we've all felt the sting of unsatisfaction. Singles can learn some things about marriage and married folks can be encouraged through our honesty.

Singles can learn some things about marriage and married folks can be encouraged through our honesty.Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Meet the Lindseys

item.content:encoded:
This is Life is a fun, interactive and conversational podcast where we discuss real issues with a positive and wholesome perspective. Engage with Cornelius and Heather during their special segment, "Ask the Lindseys," where you can ask real questions and receive real answers. We’re talking about everyday issues that affect everyday people with personal insight and our own mix of straight-talk and humor. New episodes every Friday morning. Hope you join us! Subscribe Today!
